title: Kenai Fjords National Park: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons        Visitors walking the trails near Exit Glacier. NPS / Kaitlin Thoresen       Kenai Fjords National Park The park is open year-round. The primary months to visit are June, July, and August. There are reduced services in the area during the months of May and September.  The road to the Exit Glacier area is not plowed during the winter months, and is closed to cars and trucks once snow begins falling on it.  The park's coastal backcountry is also inaccessible late fall through early spring due to rough seas.      Visitor Centers The following are the dates and hours of operation for the park's visitor facilities for the 2016 summer season.   The Kenai Fjords National Park Visitor Center in Seward's small boat harbor is open daily during the summer season.       May 7 - 8, 14 - 15 and 21 - 27  9:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.      May 28 - September 5  9:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m.    September 6 - September 14  9:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.     Contact Us / Directions       The Exit Glacier Nature Center is open daily from Memorial Day weekend through Labor Day.      May 21 - May 27  9:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.      May 28 - September 5  9:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m.    September 6 - September 14  9:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.    Directions / Shuttle Bus and Taxi Service       Winter Season During the winter months, the Kenai Fjords National Park Administrative Offices serve as the primary visitor contact center. Minimal service are available.    September 15 - May 27  8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m    CLOSED weekends and all federal holidays     Contact Us / Directions
